adjective.description: Having the characteristics of a fern of the genus Pteris or the family Pteridaceae; resembling a fern, filicoid.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Charles Lyell (1797–1875), geologist. From scientific Latin pteroides, adjective from classical Latin pteris fern + -oīdēs. With the use as noun compare scientific Latin Pteroides, plural noun<br>mid 19th century; earliest use found in Robert Mayne (1808–1868). From ancient Greek πτερόν feather, wing + -oid, in sense A. 1 after scientific Latin pteroides, adjective.
